SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To assess the role of granulocyte elastase in the development of thromboembolic vasculopathy in patients with Behçet's disease
METHODS: Plasma granulocyte elastase-alpha1-proteinase inhibitor (E-PI) complex levels were measured by ELISA in 11 healthy subjects and 19 patients with Behçet's disease (BD)
Eight of 19 patients showed deep vein thrombosis on (99m)technetium-macro-agglutinate albumin venography
Hemostatic variables were measured at the same time
RESULTS: The mean plasma E-PI complex level was significantly higher in the 8 patients with than in the 11 patients without deep vein thrombosis (242 +/- 73 vs 165 +/- 97 ng/ml; p = 0.033)
The mean plasma E-PI complex level in the 11 patients without deep vein thrombosis was significantly higher than in controls (165 +/- 97 vs 96 +/- 40 ng/ml; p = 0.038)
Plasma E-PI complex levels correlated with the serum plasmin-alpha2-plasmin inhibitor complex levels (r = 0.621, p = 0.0084)
CONCLUSION: Plasma E-PI complex levels appear to be a useful marker of thromboembolic vasculopathy in BD
